This is a ride (train drivers view) from Paris to London - Waterloo Station 
(since 2007 the Eurostar Terminus is transferred to St.Pancras railway station)
through the Channel Tunnel.

It was a release of www.video125.co.uk, which is not available anymore:

"The Eurostar DVD is being withdrawn from sale at the end of the month, 
Video 125 will be doing Brussels-St Pancras next year.  The withdrawal was 
part of the agreement when it was filmed. I would imagine Eurostar dont want 
their trains to be associated with commuter lines and DC power. The CTRL is 
much higher profile."

"Service 9025 departs Gare du Nord over the classic main line through the 
Northern suburbs of Paris. Then the pantograph tension is increased and we 
enter the LGV Nord (Ligne a Grande Vitesse Nord). Travelling at top speed for 
over half an hour on this purpose built line, encountering gradients as steep 
as 1 in 40, the TVM 430 in-cab signalling system gradually reduces the speed 
for our one intermediate stop - at Lille Europe.

The next major feature is the Channel Tunnel itself. Here, our train is 
followed both in the cab and from the Euro Tunnel control centre at Folkestone.
Emerging from the tunnel, we then travel over Britain's first high speed 
line - the Channel Tunnel Rail Link (CTRL1). After flying over Ashford 
International station and the River Medway, our complex train slows again for 
the changeover to Network Rail and the former Southern Region's third rail 
which will take us through the suburbs of South London and into Waterloo 
International."

Thanks to anotheruser from TheBox, who uploaded the ISO-File. Since I think,
that many of you folks still don't know how to deal with an ISO-File,
I decided to offer the VOB-Files. Have Fun.

*******************************************************************************
